diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of hyperthyroidism was supported by symptoms of tachycardia, weight loss, agitation, nausea, and vomiting. Thyroid function tests showed undetectable thyrotropin levels and elevated free thyroxine and triiodothyronine, consistent with overt hyperthyroidism. The presence of thyrotropin receptor antibodies confirmed Graves' disease as the underlying cause.
